subject: Ethics
title: The Nuremberg Code Origins
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Nuremberg Code Origins.

hook.text: Nazi doctors froze prisoners alive to study hypothermia. The world had to respond.

buildup.text: After WWII, the Nuremberg Trials exposed horrific medical experiments on concentration camp inmates.

discovery.text: The 1947 Nuremberg Code established ten principles, starting with voluntary consent as essential.

twist.text: Before this code, no international standard for research ethics existed. Doctors policed themselves.

climax.text: The Code declared: no experiment is justified if the subject doesn't freely agree to participate.

punchline.text: Modern research ethics was born from history's worst abuse.

quiz.question: What was the Nuremberg Code's most fundamental principle?
options: Voluntary consent of the subject is absolutely essential
Only doctors can decide who participates in research
